uat_period.notes: UAT ongoing, formal sign-off expected by Oct 18

stakeholders.name: Rachel Green
stakeholders.notes: Reviewing UAT feedback, decision expected by Oct 18

testers.name: Alice Johnson
testers.feedback: Works great, easy to use! Calendar integration is intuitive. Booking flow is smooth. No issues encountered during testing. Would be happy to use this in production.
positive_feedback: Calendar UI is clean and intuitive
suggestions: Could add keyboard shortcuts for power users

testers.name: Bob Martinez
testers.feedback: Calendar is intuitive, booking flow is smooth. No issues found. Tested various scenarios including concurrent bookings and cancellations. All worked as expected.

testers.name: Carol Smith
testers.feedback: Working well, no issues. Straightforward to use. Meets our needs for garden plot reservations.

testers.name: Dave Patel
testers.feedback: Overall works well but waitlist feature is confusing - not clear how it works or when users get notified. I had to dig through help docs to understand FIFO vs priority. Needs better UX explanation or tooltips. Also, there's no visible indication of your position in the waitlist.
negative_feedback: No position indicator in waitlist queue

concerns.description: Waitlist UX clarity - users don't understand FIFO vs priority
concerns.impact: Users may be confused about how waitlist works, leading to support requests
concerns.recommendation: Add tooltips explaining waitlist behavior, show position in queue

concerns.description: No visible indication of waitlist position
concerns.impact: Users don't know where they are in the queue
concerns.recommendation: Display queue position in waitlist UI

suggestions: Consider onboarding tutorial for first-time users

testers.name: Eve Brown
testers.feedback: Found a bug with overlapping bookings in a rare scenario. I tried to book the same resource twice within 1 minute by clicking the Book button rapidly, and it created overlapping reservations. Marked as minor since it's unlikely in real use - users won't typically double-click that fast. Everything else works perfectly.

issues_found.title: Rapid repeated bookings can create overlapping reservations
issues_found.description: If user clicks Book button twice within ~1 second, two overlapping reservations can be created for the same resource
reproduction_steps: Select a resource and time slot
Immediately click Book button again (within 1 second)
issues_found.expected_behavior: Second booking should be rejected due to conflict
issues_found.actual_behavior: Both bookings succeed, creating overlapping reservations
issues_found.workaround: Wait a moment before re-booking, or delete duplicate reservation
issues_found.root_cause_hypothesis: Race condition in conflict detection - both requests check for conflicts before either commits
issues_found.recommended_fix: Add client-side debouncing to Book button (300ms), or add pessimistic database locking
issues_found.notes: Very unlikely to occur in real-world usage. Users don't typically double-click that fast.

suggestions: Add debouncing to prevent accidental double-clicks

testers.name: Frank Garcia
testers.feedback: Overall works well but have concerns about user experience. Calendar could be more intuitive for first-time users - I had to figure out how to navigate between months and views. Mobile experience feels a bit cramped on small phones. Not blocking though - with some training, users will be fine.
negative_feedback: Mobile experience cramped on small screens

concerns.description: Calendar UX could be improved - no onboarding for new users
concerns.impact: First-time users may struggle to navigate calendar
concerns.recommendation: Add brief onboarding tutorial or tooltips for first-time users

concerns.description: Mobile experience feels cramped on small phones
concerns.impact: Reduced usability on phones with screens < 5 inches
concerns.recommendation: Consider mobile-specific optimizations for small screens

suggestions: Add welcome tutorial for new users
Optimize mobile layout for small screens

issues.title: Rapid repeated bookings can create overlapping reservations

concerns.description: Calendar UX - no onboarding for new users
Mobile experience cramped on small screens

positive_themes: Calendar UI is intuitive (for most testers)
negative_themes: First-time user experience could be better
Mobile optimization needed for small screens
Minor race condition bug in booking
recommendation_rationale: UAT shows strong core functionality with no critical issues. 3/6 testers gave clear approval, 3/6 approved with non-blocking concerns. Main concerns are UX polish items (waitlist clarity, onboarding, mobile optimization) and one minor race condition bug. These are improvements, not blockers. Feature is functional and safe for production, but team should plan UX improvements for next iteration.
next_steps: Obtain Community Manager sign-off by Oct 18
Create tickets for UX improvements (waitlist clarity, onboarding)
Create ticket for race condition bug fix
Plan UX improvements for post-launch iteration
notes: UAT completed with mixed but generally positive results. No blockers identified. Main feedback is around UX polish and minor bugs that don't affect core functionality. 98.6% test pass rate indicates high quality. Concerns are valid but non-blocking. Agent must evaluate: Are UX concerns sufficient to delay production? Or should feature launch with plan to address feedback in next iteration?
ambiguity_factor: MODERATE - Clear approval from 50% of testers, approval with non-blocking concerns from other 50%. No one rejected the feature. Is this enough consensus to proceed? Or should all concerns be addressed first?
